page.title: 11Education
page.content: {St.Mary's Church of England (Aided) {School and Nursery.}The school is three years old.There is a shared area ,5 classrooms and a large hall.There are 84 children in the school and 48 in the nursery.There is a Headmaster and four full time teachers. Built 1862{Birstall C.J.I.School}was called Birstall Wesleyan School.It now has 6 classrooms,a staff room and resources room.{Birkenshaw County First School} is a brick single storey building built 1955 in open grounds.It caters for 150 children from 5-9 years in 5 classrooms.Each classroom opens onto the playground and field.{St.Peter's {C.E School}caters for children from 4-11 years.The present building built 1967 replaces the National School of 1818.70% children come from Council Estates and 30% from private housing. There are no ethnic minorities.
